id="9"><mxCell style="output" parent="1" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="740" y="40" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Output><Connector href="" label="" id="10"><mxCell parent="1" source="7" target="9" edge="1"><mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Connector><Activity label="Prepare forecasts" spDescription="<p>There will be three official external financial forecasts issued in 2016:</p>

<p><strong>1.</strong><strong>Version 12Fb &ndash; February 2016</strong></p>

<ul style="list-style-type:circle">
	<li>To be presented to the 26 February AFC and 18 March EC meetings <em>(Only being prepared to support a modest (~US$40m) programme funding request)</em></li>
	<li>Expenditure
	<ul>
		<li>Focus on the period thru to 2020</li>
		<li>No change in underlying assumptions to version <strong>12Fa</strong> issued in December 2015</li>
		<li>A new funding request (for new routine NVS programmes that were reviewed by the IRC in November 2015) will however be moved from &ldquo;Balance of Demand&rdquo; to &ldquo;New Request&rdquo;</li>
		<li>To support the &ldquo;programme funding request&rdquo; a cash flow forecast with a time horizon of 2016-2021 will be required per the Programme Funding Policy. For calculating 2021, we should look back at the doses from the version 12 of the ADF dose file to see how doses change in 2021 vs 2020 and then make a high level adjustment to the 2020 number we had forecasted in version 12Fa to arrive at an estimate 2021 value. (We probably cannot simply take 2020 number for 2021 given the impact of graduation). &nbsp;</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Cash inflows
	<ul>
		<li>No change to forecast presented in version 12Fb</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>2.</strong><strong>Version 12Fc &ndash; May 2016</strong></p>

<ul style="list-style-type:circle">
	<li>To be presented to the 4 May AFC and 22-23 June Board meetings</li>
	<li>Expenditure
	<ul>
		<li>Focus on the period thru to 2020</li>
		<li>No change in underlying assumptions to version <strong>12Fa</strong> issued in December 2015 with the following exceptions:
		<ul>
			<li>India and Measles strategy expenditures to be fully incorporated in the forecast</li>
			<li>2015 actuals will be incorporated and, if appropriate, changes will be made to 2016 numbers</li>
			<li>Any material changes</li>
		</ul>
		</li>
		<li>A new funding request (covering minimally malaria and meningitis stockpile continuation) will be included. Depending on whether the new funding request was already forecasted or not, will drive whether this in incremental expenditure or not</li>
		<li>A Programme Expenditure Report for 2015 will also be included and for Q1 2016</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Cash inflows
	<ul>
		<li>Update for 2015 actuals</li>
		<li>Update 2016-2020 for latest FX rates and new information on donor contributions etc.</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>3.</strong><strong>Version 14Fa &ndash; October 2016</strong></p>

<ul style="list-style-type:circle">
	<li>To be presented to 21 October AFC and 7-8 December Board meetings</li>
	<li>Expenditure
	<ul>
		<li>Focus on the period thru to 2025</li>
		<li>Full update based off the &ldquo;new&rdquo; v14 &ldquo;operational forecast&rdquo;. Forecast will be prepared for the period thru to 2030 although we will only present thru to 2025.</li>
		<li>Forecast will include &ldquo;range&rdquo; (criteria to be defined) as well as a &ldquo;point&rdquo; forecast for the purpose of programme funding decision approval</li>
		<li>Early input from Seth and Anuradha to agree on handling of strategic drivers of the forecast numbers</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Cash flows
	<ul>
		<li>Full&nbsp; update 2016-2020 for latest FX rates and new information on donor contributions etc.</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

<p>In addition to the above &ldquo;official&rdquo; forecasts, <strong>version 13Fa forecast will be produced for internal purposes to test the forecasting methodology that builds off the operational forecast</strong>. We will use version 13 also to think thru what we mean by ranges etc. We will NOT share version 13 externally.</p>
" spResponsible="" spAccountable="" spSupport="" spConsulted="" spInformed="" spCompetencies="" spDuration="" spPersonDays="" spPolicies="" spKPIs="" spSupportingTechnology="" spStatus="" spID="1933" spParentIDs="56" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33802" spRecommendations="" spComments="" href="" id="12"><mxCell style="activity" parent="1" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="70" y="140" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Activity></root></mxGraphModel>

spParentIDs="57" spDescription="<p><a href="http://www.gavi.org/support/nvs/">New and Underused Vaccines Support (NVS)</a></p>

<p>VIG (Vaccine Implementation Grant)</p>

<p>Operational Costs</p>

<p>Human Papillomavirus (HPV)&nbsp;Demonstration</p>

<p>Switch Grants</p>

<p>Immunisation Services Support (ISS) (no longer exists)</p>

<p>Vaccines:</p>

<p><a href="http://www.gavi.org/support/nvs/">NEW AND UNDERUSED VACCINES SUPPORT</a></p>

<ul>

 <li><a href="http://www.gavi.org/support/nvs/meningitis-a/">Meningitis A vaccine</a></li>

 <li><a href="http://www.gavi.org/support/nvs/yellow-fever/">Yellow fever vaccine</a></li>
</ul>
" spComments="" spRecommendations="" spStatus="" spSupportingTechnology="" spKPIs="" spPolicies="" spPersonDays="" spDuration="" spCompetencies="" spInformed="" spConsulted="" spSupport="" spAccountable="" spResponsible="432" id="25"><mxCell style="activity" vertex="1" parent="24"><mxGeometry width="80" as="geometry" height="60" y="100" x="435" /></mxCell></Activity><Decision href="" label="Grant financing required?" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33804" spID="1557" spParentIDs="57" spDescription="<p>This process requires a greater understanding of the Country Journey that leads them to Gavi, including their Governmental fiscal planning, health policies and fiscal planning, available human and financial resources, such that our channels, policies, guidelines, and communications better suit their needs from the perspective of content, context, and timeliness.</p>
" spStatus="Initial draft" spSupportingTechnology="" spKPIs="" spDuration="" spInformed="" spConsulted="" spSupport="" spAccountable="" spResponsible="432" id="98"><mxCell style="decisionExtended" vertex="1" parent="24"><mxGeometry width="80" as="geometry" height="60" y="100" x="300" /></mxCell></Decision><Input href="" label="Country annual health planning review / refresh" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33803" spID="" spRelatedOutputID="" spParentIDs="57" spDescription="<p>Taking a Country-centric approach, Receiving Grant Support, starts with the Country through the Country Multi Year Plan (CMYP). results.Title: Review grant renewal application (HLRP)
results.GraphXML:

Therefore, given the current HLRP timelines (May, July, October), an Information Letter outlining projected (unapproved) dollars and doses is required to be sent in September so that each Country has visibility to current Gavi understanding of upcoming grant renewal dollars and doses in advance of submitting aggregated vaccine order quantities to Unicef Supply Division (required by no later than 30 September).</p>

Switch Grants

Immunisation Services Support (ISS) (no longer exists)

Vaccines:

NEW AND UNDERUSED VACCINES SUPPORT

  • Human papillomavirus vaccine
  • Inactivated polio vaccine
  • Injection safety support
  • Japanese encephalitis vaccine
  • Measles vaccine
  • Meningitis A vaccine
  • Oral cholera vaccine
  • Pentavalent vaccine
  • Pneumococcal vaccine
  • Measles-rubella vaccine
  • Rotavirus vaccine

<p>WHO defines six building blocks that contribute to a strengthened health system:</p>

<ul>
 <li><strong>Health service delivery:</strong>&nbsp;a network of integrated and people-centred health facilities to provide access to primary and secondary care;</li>
 <li><strong>Health workers</strong>, in the right place, at the right time with training, experience and incentives;</li>
 <li><strong>Logistics and supply systems,</strong>&nbsp;including an adequate cold chain in place to deliver vaccines;</li>
 <li><strong>Health financing</strong>&nbsp;to raise sufficient funds for health and improve financial risk protection;</li>
 <li><strong>Health information and monitoring</strong>&nbsp;to generate quality data and to measure what is being done and achieved;</li>
 <li><strong>Leadership and governance</strong>&nbsp;to ensure that a strategic policy framework exists and there is proper accountability and oversight.</li>
</ul>

results.Title: HSS
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Health Systems Strengthening Support and Civil Society Organisations Support

WHO defines six building blocks that contribute to a strengthened health system:

  • Health service delivery: a network of integrated and people-centred health facilities to provide access to primary and secondary care;
  • Health workers, in the right place, at the right time with training, experience and incentives;
  • Logistics and supply systems, including an adequate cold chain in place to deliver vaccines;
  • Health financing to raise sufficient funds for health and improve financial risk protection;
  • Health information and monitoring to generate quality data and to measure what is being done and achieved;
  • Leadership and governance to ensure that a strategic policy framework exists and there is proper accountability and oversight.

Are processes the responsibility of the Policy (and Performance) department? This would help us clarify Process ownership as well, which is a key &#39;layer&#39; in the Process Maturity framework.</p>

<p>I would recommend that we baseline all &#39;live&#39; Policies and frame them against the existing Processes to identify gaps and a process map roadmap and prioritisation list.</p>

results.ProcessItemDescription: Each stakeholder within the Secretariat now clears each decision letter, sequentially as follows:  VI/HSS/FS&G, Legal, Finance.   The PO is responsible for tracking the clearance of each DL with each team, ensuring that the DLs are cleared by each team within 2 working days with any team. Tracking sheet:  http://intranet/team/CS/Decision%20Letters/Forms/AllItems.aspx

results.Title: Clear Decision Letter
results.ProcessItemDescription: The first team (VI / HSS / FS&G) clears the DL (and initials/dates the Sharepoint tracking sheet) and sends an email to the next team, copying the relevant PO, informing that they have cleared the DL, and it is now ready for Legal to clear. The first team provides the next with the file location. The Decision Letter is not emailed.

results.Title: Clear Decision Letter
results.ProcessItemDescription: The first team (VI / HSS / FS&G) clears the DL (and initials/dates the Sharepoint tracking sheet) and sends an email to the next team, copying the relevant PO, informing that they have cleared the DL, and it is now ready for Legal to clear. The first team provides the next with the file location. The Decision Letter is not emailed.

results.Title: Clear Decision Letter
results.ProcessItemDescription: The first team (VI / HSS / FS&G) clears the DL (and initials/dates the Sharepoint tracking sheet) and sends an email to the next team, copying the relevant PO, informing that they have cleared the DL, and it is now ready for Legal to clear. The first team provides the next with the file location. The Decision Letter is not emailed.

results.Title: Clear non-standard Decision Letter
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Standard â€œvanillaâ€ decision letters no longer need to be reviewed by the legal team. However, legal would continue to review non-standard decision letters, such as where the templates are not followed or non-standard language or extra conditions are introduced.  Legal would also continue to review decision letter templates.

Legal clears non-standard decision letter (and initials/dates the Sharepoint tracking sheet) and sends an email to the next team, copying the relevant PO, informing that they have cleared the DL, and it is now ready for Finance. Legal provides Finance with the file location. The Decision Letter is not emailed.

results.Title: Clear Decision Letter
results.ProcessItemDescription: FIN clears the DL (and initials/dates the Sharepoint tracking sheet) and sends an email to PO informing that they have cleared the DL, and it is now ready for finalisation and sending out. The Decision Letter is not emailed.

results.Title: Review Decision Letter & Management Letter. Print Letters.

results.Title: Scan and save Decision & Management Letters
results.ProcessItemDescription: The signed Decision and Management Letters are scanned and saved as PDF documents in the relevant SharePoint location (xxx) with nomenclature to enable easy identification and retrieval.

results.Title: Send PDF files to country counterparts and copy partners, legal
results.ProcessItemDescription: The Decision Letter .pdfs are now sent to the country counterparts (EPI manager etc.), with email copies to all relevant partners and Legal (all CCs are listed on the cover letter and in the tracking document)   Any revisions/updates to DLs need to be annotated and filed with the original DL.

results.Title: Decision Letter published to website
results.ProcessItemDescription: The Decision Letters are published to the Gavi website by the Country Communications team once every three months, in line with GAVIâ€™s Access to Information Policy.

results.Title: Support writing of draft decision letter
Create and prepare CDR (S01)
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Provided that there are no unresolved financial management issues or co-financing problems and that the country has a valid PFA (Partnership Framework Agreement).

Cash Disbursement Request (CDR) created in online CDR system: http://intranet/team/CS/CDR/Pages/home.aspx

S01 refers to Step 1 while more investigation is required to document how Disbursement figures are determined and agreed with Country and Secretariat.

results.Title: Review and approve CDR (S02)
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Review the CDR and confirm that all pre-requisite conditions for this payment have been satisfied, and the payment is in accordance with Gavi's legal commitments with the beneficiary. Based on the review

  1. Reject;
  2. Ask for clarifications; or
  3. Approve

Please note: Country Responsible Officer (CRO) is a term long replaced by Senior Country Manager (SCM). Please replace any and all instance of CRO with SCM.

Understood as Step 2 (S2). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

results.Title: Review and approve CDR (S03)
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Review the request and the supporting documentation. Based on the review:

  1. Reject;
  2. Ask for clarifications; or
  3. Recommend the payment.

Inferred to be Step 3 (S03) ('Head of Country Team', which is ambiguous as a Country Head is a Senior Country Manager (SCM; S2) and a Head of multiple Countries is a Regional Head). To be confirmed and more investigation required on what informs a Regional Head's decision-making parameters.

results.Title: Request >$2M / Region Head an SCM
results.ProcessItemDescription: Request > $2 million, or Head is equal to Senior Country Manager (SCM)

results.Title: Quality assurance check of CDR (S05)
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Review the request and the supporting documentation. Confirm all relevant documentation is attached and the request is valid. Based on the review:

  1. Reject;
  2. Ask for clarifications; or
  3. Recommend the payment.

Step 5 referred to as S05. However, further investigation required to clarify what inputs inform IM&QA's quality assurance check.

results.Title: Review and approve CDR (S04)
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Review the request and the supporting documentation. Based on the review:

  1. Reject;
  2. Ask for clarifications; or
  3. Recommend the payment.

Understood as Step 4 (S4). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

results.Title: Review and approve CDR (S06)
results.ProcessItemDescription:
AS-CPG is not defined. Open action to clarify 'Who'? Best practice not maintained as acronym not defined.

Confirm that all relevant documents to support this payment are attached. Based on the review:

  1. Reject;
  2. Ask for clarifications; or
  3. Recommend the payment.

Inferred to be Step 6 (S06) as preceding step is S05 and following step is Step 06b. However, Accounting Specialist and Controller have been used interchangeable and, therefore, require Finance validation. Also, business rules informing review and approval constraints remain outstanding.

results.Title: Review and approve CDR (S06b)
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Confirm that the bank account number exists and is correct. Based on the review:

  1. Reject;
  2. Ask for clarifications; or
  3. Recommend the payment.

Understood as Step 6b (S6b). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

results.Title: Review and approve CDR (S07)
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Confirm that there is a corresponding budget approved for this payment. Attach relevant supporting documents. Based on the review:

  1. Reject;
  2. Ask for clarifications; or
  3. Recommend the payment.

Confirmed with Dita Mocova that Step 8 has been collapsed into Step 7, resulting in an overall time savings of 1 day, as the original 2-day time commitment the Senior Finance Maager has been expanded to 3 days as more investigation is required, rather than two roles with two days apiece.

results.Title: Review and approve CDR (S08)
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Review the request and supporting documents. Based on the review:

  1. Reject;
  2. Ask for clarifications; or
  3. Recommend the payment.

Understood as Step 8 (S8). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

results.Title: Review and approve CDR (S09)
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Can be performed by Managing Director or Senior Director of Finance.

Approve the payment. Based on the review:

  1. Reject;
  2. Ask for clarifications; or
  3. Approve the payment.

Understood as Step 9 (9). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

results.Title: Enter payment into online banking system (S10)
results.ProcessItemDescription: Understood as the Step 10 (S10). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

results.Title: Release the payment in the banking system
Confirm payment made (S12)
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Inform the Programme Officer and Senior Country Manager of the completion of the wire transfer including the amount paid and the value date.

Referred to as Step 12 (S12). However, further information to be captured as per fields below (Supporting Technology, KPIs, etc).

CDR tool presents S12 as being owned by the Programme Officer while the process map outlines Finance. Correction to be made with Finance and Business confirmation.

results.Title: Release payment in banking system (S11)
results.ProcessItemDescription: Understood as the Step 11 (S11). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

results.Title: TBC: Respond to request for clarification
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Given that Comments (formerly referred to as 'Clarifications') are not captured in the IRC, is not clear how this step relates to the HLRP process (unlike the IRC, which does capture 'Comments', which are documented as Issues to Be Addressed).

In ad

results.Title: TBC: Draft Decision Letter and Management Letter
results.ProcessItemDescription: It is not clear how the Record of Proceedings from the HLRP informs the production of the DL or Management Letter as there are no Country-level 'strengthening actions' in the Record and, therefore, there are no definitive inputs from the HLRP into DLs or Management Letters.

results.Title: PPC
results.ProcessItemDescription: Is PPC supposed to represent the Policy & Performance Department? I think we should avoid acronyms, particularly if we are not including explantory notes in the Description.

results.Title: Design process (including scope)
results.Policies: Input to come from the Policy & Performance team
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Who is the point of contact for designing process(es)? Are processes the responsibility of the Policy (and Performance) department? If so, I would recommend that we review all As Is and To Be processes with the corresponding Policy author(s) / owner(s). This would help us clarify Process ownership as well, which is a key 'layer' in the Process Maturity framework.

I would recommend that we baseline all 'live' Policies and frame them against the existing Processes to identify gaps and a process map roadmap and prioritisation list.
results.KPIs: Number of Approved 'Out of policy' Grants, Number of Disbursed 'Out of policy' Grants

results.Title: Notice of resignation
results.ProcessItemDescription: Notice of resignation is usually sent by the staff member, or otherwise by their manager.

results.Title: Is staff eligible for international benefits? (i.e. repatriation, home leave)
Send international benefits email template with outlined attachments to staff and schedule one hour exit interview
Send non-international local benefits email template with outlined attachments to staff and schedule one hour exit interview
Do you plan to take any leave days prior to resignation date?
Confirm approval of leave days with manager - confirm both last working date and contract end date
Confirm contract end date with manager
Respond to HRBP email with all requested details and completed paperwork
Return Gavi belongings to HR, IT, Operations and Finance
Review staff responses, confirm are they eligible for repatriation? Ensure Sr. HR Admin cc'd on response
Select team member record in Me@Gavi click Terminate and enter all details, select YES for repatriation flag

Update form once items are returned, enter date completed and click submit

results.ProcessItemDescription: A product switch is when a country changes from the current vaccine product to a new vaccine product.  A country can request a product switch for any Gavi-supported vaccine at any time. Changing a product has various implications on programme implementation at the country level, as well as Gaviâ€™s financing requirements, policies, processes, and supply / demand management.

results.Title: Formal request
results.ProcessItemDescription: In some cases, the country may not be required to submit a formal request. These cases may include, if a country needs to switch products due to supply constraints. In this case the country will be informed by the Alliance.

results.Title: Receive formal request and share with internal teams
Receive formal request and share with internal teams
Review request
results.ProcessItemDescription: Always involve.

results.Title: Review request
results.ProcessItemDescription: Depending on the type of request, you may want to involve the Legal Department.

results.Title: Review request
results.ProcessItemDescription: Always involve.

results.Title: Review request
results.ProcessItemDescription: Depending on the type of request, you may want to involve Market Shaping.

results.Title: Discuss request and identify any programmatic implications
Discuss request, confirm supply availability and timing
Convene internal meeting. Discuss request and provide recommendations
results.ProcessItemDescription: As each product switch request will be unique, it is at the discrection of the SCM and PM whether to convene an internal meeting. In some cases, it may be sufficient to discuss the issues via email and obtain email approval.

results.Title: Draft letter to the country with recommendations for approval by Managing Director, Country Programmes
Discuss request and provide recommendations
results.ProcessItemDescription: Always involve.

results.Title: Discuss request and provide recommendations
results.ProcessItemDescription: If relevant to the Switch grant request.

results.Title: Discuss request and provide recommendations
results.ProcessItemDescription: Always involve.

results.Title: Discuss request and provide recommendations
results.ProcessItemDescription: If relevant to the Switch grant request.

results.Title: Draft letter
results.ProcessItemDescription: Draft Memo and Draft Letter should go together for approval.

results.Title: Agree with recommendation of SCM & VPM
Inform country with information letter and request plans for implementation
Share approved letter with relevant internal and external parties
Product Switch Tracking Sheet
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Document comments, associated information and outcomes in product switch tracking sheet.

W:\Country Support\vaccine implementation\11. Pneumo & Rota\Pneumo\Supply & Demand\Product switches

The above example contains a sample tracking sheet used to track PCV product switches. This tracking sheet should be used as a sample for you and it is up to your discretion to include all relevant information.

results.Title: Begin process to revise Decision Letter and provide switch grant if relevant
results.ProcessItemDescription: Process should take place in line with High Level Review Panel (HLRP). If possible, the decision letter should be revised according to HLRP timelines to avoid additional work. If the request is out of sync with HLRP, then the SCM should initiate a revision of the current DL to reflect the new product being used.

results.Title: Monitoring & Reporting
results.GraphXML:
<mxGraphModel><root><Graph label="Graph" href="http://www.mxgraph.com/" id="0"><mxCell/></Graph><Layer label="Default Layer" spId="" spGuid="" spID="1384" id="1"><mxCell parent="0"/></Layer><Activity label="Joint Appraisal" spDescription="<p>The joint appraisal is a key step in Gavi&rsquo;s grant renewal process. It is an annual, in-country, multistakeholder review of the implementation progress and performance of Gavi&rsquo;s vaccine and cash grant support to the country, and of its contribution to improved immunisation outcomes. While some of the analysis required for this appraisal may be available from recent reviews of the immunisation programme, it should not be viewed as a review of the national immunisation programme.</p>

<p>The objectives of a Joint Appraisal are:</p>

<ul>
 <li>To identify persistent challenges impeding progress, in particular toward improved&nbsp;coverage and equity.</li>
 <li>To highlight areas where greater national investments and efforts, as well as&nbsp;technical support, are needed.</li>
 <li>To inform the Gavi&rsquo;sdecision on the renewal of its grants, and enable consideration&nbsp;of how to optimize its catalytic support to help improve immunization outcomes.</li>
</ul>

<p>More information is available in the&nbsp;<a href="http://intranet/team/gamr/Working_Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?RootFolder=/team/gamr/Working_Documents/Working%20Groups/Appraisals/Appraisal%20report%20template%20and%20guidance/Final%20joint%20appraisal%20documents%20-%20March%202015&amp;FolderCTID=0x012000396431BBDA20DD4EAAB3085F0EDFADC5">Joint Appraisal Guidelines</a>.</p>
" spResponsible="" spAccountable="" spSupport="" spConsulted="" spInformed="" spCompetencies="" spDuration="" spPersonDays="" spPolicies="" spKPIs="" spSupportingTechnology="" spStatus="" spID="1397" spParentIDs="1384" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33802" spRecommendations="" spComments="" href="" id="2"><mxCell style="activity" parent="1" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="160" y="30" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Activity></root></mxGraphModel>

results.ProcessItemDescription:
The joint appraisal is a key step in Gaviâ€™s grant renewal process. It is an annual, in-country, multistakeholder review of the implementation progress and performance of Gaviâ€™s vaccine and cash grant support to the country, and of its contribution to improved immunisation outcomes. While some of the analysis required for this appraisal may be available from recent reviews of the immunisation programme, it should not be viewed as a review of the national immunisation programme.

The objectives of a Joint Appraisal are:

  • To identify persistent challenges impeding progress, in particular toward improved coverage and equity.
  • To highlight areas where greater national investments and efforts, as well as technical support, are needed.
  • To inform the Gaviâ€™sdecision on the renewal of its grants, and enable consideration of how to optimize its catalytic support to help improve immunization outcomes.

More information is available in the Joint Appraisal Guidelines.

results.ProcessItemDescription:
Given that Comments (formerly referred to as 'Clarifications') are not captred in the HLRP forum it is not clear how this process step or decision relates to the current HLRP process.

In addition, given that HLRP 'Strenghening Actions' are not captured at a Country-level, it is not clear what an SCM would action or clarify with a Country.

results.ProcessItemDescription:
Request to hire a consultant â€“ over four months

  • Actors â€“ 4
  • Decision Points â€“ 6
  • Approvals â€“ 4

Request to hire a consultant â€“ under four months

  • Actors â€“ 2
  • Decision Points â€“ 2
  • Approvals â€“ 1

Procurement Process:

  • Actors: 14
  • Decision Points 19
  • Approvals: 15

results.Title: Executive Team Member (Managing Director)
results.ProcessItemDescription: Director of the line manager requesting a consultant.

results.Title: Duration of time consultant is required for
What type of contractor is required?
results.ProcessItemDescription:
• Temp via agency - engaged through placement agency (for example, administrative assistant)
  • Technical support (for example, cleaner)
  • Consultant (onsite or offsite) - engaged through consulting firm (for example IT specialists from Blue Infinity)
  • Independent Contractor (onsite or offsite) - hired directly through their own firm (for example specialist consultants)

results.Title: Complete ICA form and supporting documents
results.ProcessItemDescription:
http://intranet/team/HR/Resourcing/Forms/AllItems.aspx

Independent Contractor Agreement form.

Supporting documents:

  • Job description
  • Justification memo from Executive Team (ET) member
  • Organigram

results.Title: Review ICA form and documents
results.ProcessItemDescription:
For example:

  • Review justification memo from ET member
  • Review job description
  • Review organisation chart

results.Title: Notify requesting team and procurement
results.ProcessItemDescription: Email the requiesting team and procurement if the request has been approved or rejected.

results.Title: Create contract for contractor
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Define conditions of contract

Negotiate fee

Ensure deliverables are defined

results.Title: Create requisition in AX
results.ProcessItemDescription: Axxapta finance systems for purchase orders

results.Title: Send contract and PO to contractor or temp agency
Set up systems access and IT equipment
Prepare workspace and building badge access
Track for budget purpose
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Clarity and budget tracking list.

Check if contractor requires access to financial systems.

results.Title: Review purchase requisition
results.ProcessItemDescription: Review amount, contract, conditions, content of terms of reference.

results.Title: Review purchase requisition
results.ProcessItemDescription: Review amount and content of the contract.

results.Title: Review budget line
results.ProcessItemDescription: Check that there is enough money in the budget and that the correct budget line is being used.

results.Title: Review purchase requisition
results.ProcessItemDescription: Review contents, rate, contact details, terms of reference.

results.Title: Head of FPA
results.ProcessItemDescription: Head of Financial Planning and Analysis

results.Title: Enter request for resource at me@gavi
Review request for resource
results.ProcessItemDescription: Have discussed request with requestor and request is appropriate and there is an appropriate budget for it.

results.Title: Review request for resource
results.ProcessItemDescription: Review that it is the appropriate type of request, the duration of the mission and making sure that choosing a temp via agency contract is the right type of contract to choose and not a consultant for example.

results.Title: Review request for resource
results.ProcessItemDescription: Review that the team has the budget for it and it is on the right budget line.

results.Title: Review request for resource
results.ProcessItemDescription: Review the team structure and number of resources.

results.Title: Manage recruitment
results.ProcessItemDescription:
• Review job description (JD)
  • Contact agencies
  • Advertise position to the agencies
  • Collect candidates CVs
  • Assist hiring manager to do final selections for interviews or help in selecting the final selected candidate

results.Title: Prepare exhibit
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Exhibit template

When completed, send to procurement and cc: focal point.

results.Title: Review exhibit
results.ProcessItemDescription: Look for form, make sure it respects standards, conditions and if it is complete, such as price, content, number of days.

results.Title: Approve exhibit
results.ProcessItemDescription:
If approved, email team focal point.

If not approved, go back to HRBP to review it.

results.Title: Type of grant
results.ProcessItemDescription: Depending on the type of grant, the approval request will be approved by either the Board and Executive Committee, or the CEO.

results.Title: Grant AR
results.ProcessItemDescription: Note, the type of grant approval request will vary depending on the grant and subsequent approval process.

results.Title: Grant Approval Request
results.ProcessItemDescription: Note, the type of grant approval request will vary depending on the grant and subsequent approval process.

results.Title: Is HLRP taking place in October?
Prepare Pre-October HLRP Information Letter
results.ProcessItemDescription: Given Unicef Supply Division procurement requirements, all vaccine columes are to be finalised by 30 September in order to meet following-year stock requirements. Therefore, given the current HLRP timelines (May, July, October), an Information Letter outlining projected (unapproved) dollars and doses is required to be sent in September so that each Country has visibility to current Gavi understanding of upcoming grant renewal dollars and doses in advance of submitting aggregated vaccine order quantities to Unicef Supply Division (required by no later than 30 September).

results.Title: Unicef Supply Division
results.ProcessItemDescription: Given Unicef Supply Division procurement requirements, all vaccine columes are to be finalised by 30 September in order to meet following-year stock requirements. Therefore, given the current HLRP timelines (May, July, October), an Information Letter outlining projected (unapproved) dollars and doses is required to be sent in September so that each Country has visibility to current Gavi understanding of upcoming grant renewal dollars and doses in advance of submitting aggregated vaccine order quantities to Unicef Supply Division (required by no later than 30 September).

results.ProcessItemDescription:
Currently, staff on payroll and interns as well as temp via agency hires.

Request to hire a consultant â€“ over four months

  • Actors â€“ 8
  • Decision Points â€“ 7
  • Approvals â€“ 3 (DCEO or HRD approval is required so have not counted twice)

Request to hire a consultant â€“ under four months

  • Actors â€“ 2
  • Decision Points â€“ 1
  • Approvals â€“ 1 (Hiring manager must have approval of ET member prior to entering request)

Request to hire a consultant â€“ through an entity

  • Actors â€“ 2
  • Decision Points â€“ 1
  • Approvals â€“ 1 (Hiring manager must have approval of ET member prior to entering request)

results.Title: Request to hire / extend a resource in me@gavi
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Enter information in me@gavi such as:

  • Type of role (permanent or temporary, external consultant); if temporary, is it replacing a current staff.
  • Anticipated start date
  • Contract end date
  • Budgeted or un-budgeted
  • Attach job description

results.Title: Review request for a resource
results.ProcessItemDescription: Look at job description and ensure they agree with the vacancy that it is within the headcount and budget and it is a suitable quiality job description.

results.Title: Record of rejected request
results.ProcessItemDescription: Record of reject request in me@gavi.

results.Title: Review request for a resource
results.ProcessItemDescription: Review request against budget.

results.Title: Validate request for a resource
results.ProcessItemDescription: Audit the request and ensure the informaiton has been entered correctly and all the information is correct.

results.Title: Is the request budgeted for
results.ProcessItemDescription: Information is entered by the Hiring Manager at the time of making the request if the position is budgeted for or not.

results.Title: Consult with hiring manager/ ET member
results.ProcessItemDescription: This is exceptional and rare.  The Deputy CEO would be informed ahead of time that the request is coming and why.

results.Title: Review request for a resource
results.ProcessItemDescription: Review all of the details of the request, the type of hire and that the position and the reasons for hire.

results.Title: Record of approved request
results.ProcessItemDescription: Record of approved request in me@gavi.

results.Title: Record of approved request
results.ProcessItemDescription: Record of approved request in me@gavi.

results.Title: Contract duration more than 4 months
results.ProcessItemDescription: Does not apply to extensions.

results.Title: Procure resource
results.ProcessItemDescription:
There are multiple steps involved in this process managed by procurement, such as:

  • Negotiate the fees
  • Prepare the exhibit and the contract

results.Title: Validate request for a resource
results.ProcessItemDescription: Audit the request and ensure the informaiton has been entered correctly and all the information is correct.

results.Title: Review request for a resource

results.Title: Review exceptional request
results.ProcessItemDescription: Decide whether to support an unbudgeted request.

results.Title: Onboarding request form
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Form to be entered into Service Now, or other suitable platform with the following details:

First Name, Last Name, Manager, Title, Team Assistant, Personal Phone Number, Start Date, End Date, FTE %, Daily Rate, me@gavi vacancy number (if vacancy was requested through me@gavi) or Purchase Order number (if approved through procurement).

Open question: When would a manager complete which field - vacancy number or purchase order number?

results.Title: Finance AP
results.ProcessItemDescription: Finance Accounts Payable

results.Title: me@gavi
results.ProcessItemDescription: Five days before the external resource's contract end date, me@gavi will send an automated notification to the consultant, manager, team focal point, operations, finance, service desk, HR and procurement.

results.Title: End of contract notification
results.ProcessItemDescription:
3-4 weeks (TBD), notification will be sent automatically from me@gavi to the Manager and Focal Point that the external resource's contract is due to end. If the Manager wishes to extend the contract, they will need to intervene with the process through me@gavi by requesting a contract extension.

If no request is entered, five days before the external resource's contract end date, me@gavi will send an automated notification to the consultant, manager, team focal point, operations, finance, service desk, HR and procurement.

results.Title: Complete offboarding exit form
results.ProcessItemDescription: Check that external resource has returned security badge.

results.Title: Complete offboarding exit form
results.ProcessItemDescription: Confirm receipt of laptop, mobile and any other equipment.

results.Title: Return Gavi belongings
results.ProcessItemDescription: Security card, laptop, mobile phone, CDL.

results.Title: Extend contract?
results.ProcessItemDescription: 3-4 weeks (TBD), notification will be sent automatically from me@gavi to the Manager and Focal Point.

results.Title: Complete offboarding exit form
results.ProcessItemDescription: Close any accounts.

results.Title: Complete offboarding exit form
results.ProcessItemDescription: Confirm receipt of CDL.

results.Title: Review all exit forms
results.ProcessItemDescription: Check that Gavi belongings have been returned. Follow up if necessary.

results.Title: Outstanding issues?
results.ProcessItemDescription: For example if equipment has not been returned.

results.Title: Update me@gavi with staff changes
results.ProcessItemDescription:
In me@gavi update information throughout the month such as new hires, leavers, promotions, salary changes i.e. FTE change, sick leave, maternity leave, no-paid leave, acting allowances, benefit changes, education grants.

Payroll cut-off date for each month is agreed by HR and Ernst & Young and Finance on the approval and pay dates.  After the cut-off date for the month, any further payments will be processed in the following month.

Year Month Start 1st Check Final Check Approval Pay Date 
2016 January Jan-12 Jan-15 Jan-18 Jan-20 Jan-25
  February Feb-12 Feb-17 Feb-18 Feb-22 Feb-25
  March Mar-11 Mar-16 Mar-17 Mar-21 Mar-24
  April  Apr-13 Apr-16 Apr-18 Apr-20 Apr-25
  May May-12 May-17 May-19 May-20 May-25
  June Jun-14 Jun-16 Jun-20 Jun-21 Jun-24
  July Jul-12 Jul-15 Jul-18 Jul-20 Jul-25
  August Aug-12 Aug-17 Aug-19 Aug-22 Aug-25
  September Sep-12 Sep-15 Sep-19 Sep-20 Sep-23
  October Oct-12 Oct-18 Oct-19 Oct-20 Oct-25
  November  Nov-14 Nov-17 Nov-21 Nov-22 Nov-25
  December Dec-05 Dec-08 Dec-09 Dec-13 Dec-16

Liaise with the HRBP and recruiter to ensure data is correct, ongoing throughout the month.

results.Title: Advise HR Admin of staff data changes
Run payflow reports
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Seven reports are generated from payflow services section of me@gavi:

  • New hires
  • Leavers
  • Salary and employee changes
  • Recurring elements
  • Leave of Absence (LOA) non-paid
  • Leave of Absence (LOA) report
  • Employee list

results.Title: Track documentation for audit purposes
results.ProcessItemDescription: There is a payroll binder for each month with proof and supporting documentation of each change requested as well as the entry made in me@gavi.

results.Title: Run first audit of reports
results.ProcessItemDescription: Review the data in the reports against the supporting documentation to ensure the entries are all correct. Re-format each report in a readable format for Ernst & Young.

results.Title: Send first set of reports to Ernst & Young
results.ProcessItemDescription: Email reports to People Advisory Services Senior Manager.

results.Title: Perform all calculations
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Calculations related to pro-rated salaries i.e. a new hire start date after the first of the month, a leaver before the end of the month, pro-rated benefits or allowances starting after the first of the month, vacation payouts for leavers and sick leave calculations.

Included in the report the formulas used for each calculation.

results.Title: Create first set of staff payslips
Audit payslips
results.ProcessItemDescription: Audit payslips for staff with changes. Compare the payslip against the reports to ensure correct data. Audit all calculations against the calculations overview provided by Ernst & Young to ensure they are all correct.

results.Title: Are there errors in the calculations or payslip
Update payslips and calculations report if necessary
results.ProcessItemDescription: Update payslips, calculations report and comparative report and send back to Gavi HR Admin.

results.Title: Prepare payroll binder/files for approval
results.ProcessItemDescription: Print all payslips, add supporting documents to applicable staff payslips, including proof of calculations done if applicable. Print all seven payroll reports and the comparative journal.

results.Title: Approve payroll
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Meeting of Finance Controller, HR Director and HR Admin.

Review all seven payflow reports, asking for details and confirmation if necessary.

HR Admin provides supporting documentation.

Review comparative report for all staff with changes from previous month. Flag if there are any issues.

results.Title: Approve payroll
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Meeting of Finance Controller, HR Director and HR Admin.

Review all seven payflow reports, asking for details and confirmation if necessary.

HR Admin provides supporting documentation.

Review comparative report for all staff with changes from previous month. Flag if there are any issues.

results.Title: Sign off on payroll
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Initial all seven reports, confirm the number of payslips expected that month and sign-off on total amount for the salaries to be paid for the month.

Initialed documents are saved in the payroll binder.  The signed approved payroll salary comparative report is scanned and saved by the HR Admin in the confidential payroll folder.  The scanned copy of the report is sent to Ernst & Young by HR Admin.

results.Title: Sign off on payroll
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Initial all seven reports, confirm the number of payslips expected that month and sign-off on total amount for the salaries to be paid for the month.

Initialed documents are saved in the payroll binder.  The signed approved payroll salary comparative report is scanned and saved by the HR Admin in the confidential payroll folder.  The scanned copy of the report is sent to Ernst & Young by HR Admin.

results.Title: Send notification of approval to Ernst & Young
results.ProcessItemDescription: Advises to release the data transfer authorisation (DTA).

results.Title: Send DTA
results.ProcessItemDescription: Send to HR Admin with copy to HR Director, Finance Controller, and Snr. Director Finance.

results.Title: Email Snr. Director Finance
results.ProcessItemDescription: Email Snr. Director Finance, with cc to Finance Controller and HR Director to release the DTA.

results.Title: Release DTA
results.ProcessItemDescription: Advise treasury to release the payment and copies HR Admin, HR Director, Finance Controller and Ernst & Young.

results.Title: Process payment
results.ProcessItemDescription: Post payslips to Gavi HR Admin.

<p>The SDF is generated by the GAVI Secretariat demand forecasting team twice per year for a time horizon of 3<a href="#_ftn1" name="_ftnref1">[1]</a> to 20 years into the future.</p>

<p>Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for current processes can be found here and will be updated when the future processes have been determined:&nbsp;W:\Policy and Performance\Policy &amp; Market Shaping\03_Market Shaping\03_Demand Forecast\SOPs</p>

<hr />
<p><a href="#_ftnref1" name="_ftn1">[1]</a> This horizon may be revised pending the finalization of the GAVI-UNICEF operational forecast.</p>

results.ProcessItemDescription:
There will be three official external financial forecasts issued in 2016:

1.Version 12Fb â€“ February 2016

  • To be presented to the 26 February AFC and 18 March EC meetings (Only being prepared to support a modest (~US$40m) programme funding request)
  • Expenditure
    • Focus on the period thru to 2020
    • No change in underlying assumptions to version 12Fa issued in December 2015
    • A new funding request (for new routine NVS programmes that were reviewed by the IRC in November 2015) will however be moved from â€œBalance of Demandâ€ to â€œNew Requestâ€
    • To support the â€œprogramme funding requestâ€ a cash flow forecast with a time horizon of 2016-2021 will be required per the Programme Funding Policy. For calculating 2021, we should look back at the doses from the version 12 of the ADF dose file to see how doses change in 2021 vs 2020 and then make a high level adjustment to the 2020 number we had forecasted in version 12Fa to arrive at an estimate 2021 value. (We probably cannot simply take 2020 number for 2021 given the impact of graduation).  
  • Cash inflows
    • No change to forecast presented in version 12Fb

2.Version 12Fc â€“ May 2016

  • To be presented to the 4 May AFC and 22-23 June Board meetings
  • Expenditure
    • Focus on the period thru to 2020
    • No change in underlying assumptions to version 12Fa issued in December 2015 with the following exceptions:
      • India and Measles strategy expenditures to be fully incorporated in the forecast
      • 2015 actuals will be incorporated and, if appropriate, changes will be made to 2016 numbers
      • Any material changes
    • A new funding request (covering minimally malaria and meningitis stockpile continuation) will be included. Depending on whether the new funding request was already forecasted or not, will drive whether this in incremental expenditure or not
    • A Programme Expenditure Report for 2015 will also be included and for Q1 2016
  • Cash inflows
    • Update for 2015 actuals
    • Update 2016-2020 for latest FX rates and new information on donor contributions etc.

3.Version 14Fa â€“ October 2016

  • To be presented to 21 October AFC and 7-8 December Board meetings
  • Expenditure
    • Focus on the period thru to 2025
    • Full update based off the â€œnewâ€ v14 â€œoperational forecastâ€. Forecast will be prepared for the period thru to 2030 although we will only present thru to 2025.
    • Forecast will include â€œrangeâ€ (criteria to be defined) as well as a â€œpointâ€ forecast for the purpose of programme funding decision approval
    • Early input from Seth and Anuradha to agree on handling of strategic drivers of the forecast numbers
  • Cash flows
    • Full  update 2016-2020 for latest FX rates and new information on donor contributions etc.

In addition to the above â€œofficialâ€ forecasts, version 13Fa forecast will be produced for internal purposes to test the forecasting methodology that builds off the operational forecast. We will use version 13 also to think thru what we mean by ranges etc. We will NOT share version 13 externally.

Other source of data is the WHO quarterly call with the regions.</p>

" spResponsible="523" spAccountable="" spSupport="" spConsulted="" spInformed="" spCompetencies="" spDuration="" spPersonDays="" spPolicies="" spKPIs="" spSupportingTechnology="" spStatus="" spID="2147" spParentIDs="1936" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33802" spRecommendations="" spComments="" href="" id="35"><mxCell style="activity" parent="7" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="680" y="20" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Activity><Role label="Market shaping" href="" spDescription="" spDuration="" spKPIs="" spSupportingTechnology="" spStatus="" spParentIDs="1936" spParentGuid="" spID="835" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33805" spResponsible="" id="6"><mxCell style="swimlane" parent="1" vertex="1"><mxGeometry y="400" width="1330" height="430" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Role><Activity label="Create Strategic Demand Forecast" spDescription="" spResponsible="835" spAccountable="" spSupport="" spConsulted="" spInformed="" spCompetencies="" spDuration="" spPersonDays="" spPolicies="" spKPIs="" spSupportingTechnology="" spStatus="" spID="2144" spParentIDs="1936" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33802" spRecommendations="" spComments="" href="" id="29"><mxCell style="activity" parent="6" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="320" y="20" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Activity><Activity label="Prepare projection of inputs" spDescription="<p>Projections of coverage are made by following the rules below:</p>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width:867px">
 <tbody>
  <tr>
   <td style="height:19px; width:195px">&nbsp;</td>
   <td style="height:19px; width:672px">
   <p><strong>Data sources</strong></p>
   </td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
   <td style="height:19px; width:195px">
   <p><strong>Coverage projection assumptions</strong></p>
   </td>
   <td style="height:19px; width:672px">
   <ul>
    <li>Historical coverage is obtained from 2014 WUENIC estimates as of July 2015; Indian state estimates are from CES, DLHS, and NFHS surveys</li>
    <li>Projected coverage based on standard Gavi SDF coverage projection rules:
    <ul>
     <li>If 2014 coverage is &le; 90%, 1 percentage point increase per year capped at 90%</li>
     <li>If 2014 coverage is &gt; 90%, 1 percentage point increase per year capped at highest historical coverage</li>
    </ul>
    </li>
   </ul>

   <p>To adjust for anomalies in routine immunization coverage patterns, exceptions to the standard coverage projection rule were made if the following occurred:</p>

   <ul>
    <li>First, WUENIC estimates have a one-time, year-on-year negative change of &ge; 10 percentage points.&nbsp;</li>
    <li>Second, Gavi Country Programmes was consulted and agreed that the change was an anomaly and that the country is expected to increase coverage at a rate greater than 1 percentage point per year.&nbsp;</li>
    <li>Last, during the year in which the decrease in coverage occurred, the country faced one of these extraordinary situations:&nbsp;&nbsp; supply issues (e.g., stock-outs), Adverse Events Following Immunisation (AEFI) related suspensions of routine immunization, and experienced conflicts or other natural / humanitarian crises.&nbsp;</li>
   </ul>

   <p>These exceptions made are to suspend the standard coverage projection rule for the first year of projections (in this case 2015) and to reset that projection based on the historic coverage in the country.&nbsp; The standard coverage projection rule is then applied to all subsequent years. No exceptions to projected coverage were made if WUENIC revised historical coverage estimates due to the inclusion of new survey information</p>

   <ul>
    <li><strong>For Ebola-affected countries</strong>: dose and impact coverages were revised using 2012-2014 WUENIC average&nbsp;</li>
    <li><strong>Cote d&rsquo;Ivoire and South Sudan: </strong>internal conflict, dose and impact coverages were revised using 2012-2014 WUENIC average&nbsp;</li>
    <li><strong>Haiti: </strong>supply chain issues, dose and impact coverages were revised using 2011-2013 WUENIC average&nbsp;</li>
   </ul>
   </td>
  </tr>
 </tbody>
</table>

results.ProcessItemDescription:
The strategic demand forecast (SDF) has three primary uses:  (i) to inform GAVIâ€™s long-term view of required volumes (including buffer and wastage) for GAVI73 and non-GAVI LMICs included in the Decade of Vaccines; (ii) to inform GAVIâ€™s impact projections (iii) and, as the basis for calculating financial requirements for GAVI countries through the Adjusted Demand Forecast (ADF).

The SDF is generated by the GAVI Secretariat demand forecasting team twice per year for a time horizon of 3[1] to 20 years into the future.

Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for current processes can be found here and will be updated when the future processes have been determined: W:\Policy and Performance\Policy & Market Shaping\03_Market Shaping\03_Demand Forecast\SOPs

[1] This horizon may be revised pending the finalization of the GAVI-UNICEF operational forecast.

results.Title: Previous version SDF / ADF
results.ProcessItemDescription: Strategic Demand Forecast (SDF), Adjusted Demand Forecast (ADF)

results.Title: Identify drivers of price and model scenarios
Create price forecast and assess changes from previous version
Create price forecast files for sharing with stakeholders
Approve price forecast
results.ProcessItemDescription: A meeting with the Head of Market Shaping and Director of Policy & Market Shaping takes place to approve the price forecast.  If minor modifications are required, this will be made by the Senior Manager, Price Forecast and included in the price forecast files.  If major updates are required this will be made by the Senior Manager, Price Forecast and then presented again to the Head of Market Shaping and Director of Policy & Market Shaping.

results.Title: Circulate Internal Price Forecast and Public Price Forecast
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Internal Price Forecast is circulated to Market Shaping, Finance, Vaccine Implementation, Financial Sustainability & Graduation, and the CEO.

The Public Price Forecast is sent to the Country Portal, included in guidelines and by the Financial Sustainability & Graduation team.

results.Title: Review the invoice with the supplier
Country Partner?
results.ProcessItemDescription: If a country partner, requesting and receiving confirmation of receipt of a cash disbursement (i.e. a cash payment) is required. If a non-country partner, PO is not required to confirmation receipt of cash disbursement.

Johns Hopkins University,&nbsp;which&nbsp;estimates the cost and financing required of the 2011-2020 period linked to the Global Vaccine Action Plan (GVAP).&nbsp;&nbsp;The data in it is updated by the Immunisation financing and sustainability&nbsp;team. It produces multiple pieces of data and specifically for the fiscal space analysis includes estimates of the cost of traditional vaccines (how much countries have to pay for non-Gavi vaccines).</p>

<p>For more information on DOVE see:&nbsp;<a href="http://www.jhsph.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/ivac/projects/decade-of-vaccine-economics.html" target="_blank">http://www.jhsph.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/ivac/projects/decade-of-vaccine-economics.html</a></p>

<p>For more information on GVAP see:&nbsp;<a href="http://www.who.int/immunization/global_vaccine_action_plan/en/" target="_blank">http://www.who.int/immunization/global_vaccine_action_plan/en/</a></p>

results.Title: WUENIC coverage
results.ProcessItemDescription:
WHO and Unicef estimates of national immunization coverage (WUENIC) is a rule-based system implemented as a logic program, developed by WHO and UNICEF for estimating global, country by country, infant immunization coverage.

http://www.who.int/immunization/monitoring_surveillance/data/en/

results.Title: Market intelligence
results.ProcessItemDescription: Consultations with partners including manufacturers.  This is also about when new suppliers are projected to enter the market or new presentations of existing vaccines.

results.Title: Introductions, assumptions
results.ProcessItemDescription: Provided by sub-teams of Vaccine Implementation Management Team - vaccine specific sub-team lead/convened by product managers. Other source of data is the WHO quarterly call with the regions.

results.Title: Price
results.ProcessItemDescription: This is maintained by the Market Shaping team and has limited access due to the sensitive nature of its content.

results.Title: GNIPC and Eligibility projections
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Gross national income (GNI) is the sum of value added by all resident producers plus any product taxes (less subsidies) not included in the valuation of output plus net receipts of primary income (compensation of employees and property income) from abroad. GNI per capita (GNIPC) is GNI divided by mid-year population. GNI per capita in US dollars is converted using the World Bank Atlas method which smoothes exchange rate fluctuations by using a three year moving average, price-adjusted conversion factor.

http://www.gavi.org/about/governance/programme-policies/country-eligibility/

results.Title: Prepare projection of inputs
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Projections of coverage are made by following the rules below:

 

Data sources

Coverage projection assumptions
  • Historical coverage is obtained from 2014 WUENIC estimates as of July 2015; Indian state estimates are from CES, DLHS, and NFHS surveys
  • Projected coverage based on standard Gavi SDF coverage projection rules:
    • If 2014 coverage is â‰¤ 90%, 1 percentage point increase per year capped at 90%
    • If 2014 coverage is > 90%, 1 percentage point increase per year capped at highest historical coverage

To adjust for anomalies in routine immunization coverage patterns, exceptions to the standard coverage projection rule were made if the following occurred:

  • First, WUENIC estimates have a one-time, year-on-year negative change of â‰¥ 10 percentage points. 
  • Second, Gavi Country Programmes was consulted and agreed that the change was an anomaly and that the country is expected to increase coverage at a rate greater than 1 percentage point per year. 
  • Last, during the year in which the decrease in coverage occurred, the country faced one of these extraordinary situations:   supply issues (e.g., stock-outs), Adverse Events Following Immunisation (AEFI) related suspensions of routine immunization, and experienced conflicts or other natural / humanitarian crises. 

These exceptions made are to suspend the standard coverage projection rule for the first year of projections (in this case 2015) and to reset that projection based on the historic coverage in the country.  The standard coverage projection rule is then applied to all subsequent years. No exceptions to projected coverage were made if WUENIC revised historical coverage estimates due to the inclusion of new survey information

  • For Ebola-affected countries: dose and impact coverages were revised using 2012-2014 WUENIC average 
  • Cote dâ€™Ivoire and South Sudan: internal conflict, dose and impact coverages were revised using 2012-2014 WUENIC average 
  • Haiti: supply chain issues, dose and impact coverages were revised using 2011-2013 WUENIC average

DOVE model
results.ProcessItemDescription:
The Decade of Vaccines Economics (DOVE) model was developed by Johns Hopkins University, which estimates the cost and financing required of the 2011-2020 period linked to the Global Vaccine Action Plan (GVAP).  The data in it is updated by the Immunisation financing and sustainability team. It produces multiple pieces of data and specifically for the fiscal space analysis includes estimates of the cost of traditional vaccines (how much countries have to pay for non-Gavi vaccines).

For more information on DOVE see: http://www.jhsph.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/ivac/projects/decade-of-vaccine-economics.html

For more information on GVAP see: http://www.who.int/immunization/global_vaccine_action_plan/en/

results.Title: UNICEF-WHO Joint Reporting Form on Immunisation data
results.ProcessItemDescription:
Unicef- WHO Joint Reporting Form (JRF) data for producing two-pagers come from indicators 3-8 from: http://www.who.int/immunization/programmes_systems/financing/data_indicators/en/

  • Government expenditure on routine immunisation
  • Total expenditure on routine immunisation
  • Government expenditure on vaccines used in routine immunisation
  • Total expenditure on vaccines used in routine immunisation

http://www.who.int/immunization/monitoring_surveillance/routine/reporting/reporting/en/

results.Title: Conduct transition assessment
results.ProcessItemDescription: Usually involves country, Alliance partners and SCM and support from the Immunisation financing and sustainability team.  Look at financial and programmatic aspects of the EPI and analyse bottlenecks or other issues.

results.Title: Fiscal space projections
results.ProcessItemDescription: It's a traditional vaccine cost and Gavi vaccine cost projections divided by General Government Health Expenditures.

results.Title: Update DOVE model data
results.ProcessItemDescription:
The Decade of Vaccines Economics (DOVE) model was developed by Johns Hopkins University, which estimates the cost and financing required of the 2011-2020 period linked to the Global Vaccine Action Plan (GVAP).  The data in it is updated by the Immunisation financing and sustainability team. It produces multiple pieces of data and specifically for the fiscal space analysis includes estimates of the cost of traditional vaccines (how much countries have to pay for non-Gavi vaccines).

For more information on DOVE see: http://www.jhsph.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/ivac/projects/decade-of-vaccine-economics.html

For more information on GVAP see: http://www.who.int/immunization/global_vaccine_action_plan/en/

results.Title: UN DESA
results.ProcessItemDescription: Population Division of the Department of Economic and Social Affairs of the United Nations Secretariat

results.Title: Population projections
results.ProcessItemDescription: The 2015 Revision of World Population Prospects is the twenty-fourth round of official United Nations population estimates and projections that have been prepared by the Population Division of the Department of Economic and Social Affairs of the United Nations Secretariat. The main results are presented in a series of Excel files displaying key demographic indicators for each development group, income group, major area, region and country for selected periods or dates within 1950-2100. A publication labelled Key findings and advance tables, which provide insights on the results of this latest revision, is also made available from the WPP website.
